Major_Arcs.title: Circus Saga
Major_Arcs.description: The initial pages introduce a circus setting, focusing on Paul Bunyan's performance, spectator reactions, and a conflict with Billings, leading to a job offer for a new strongman.

sub_scenes.title: Circus Introduction and Spectators
sub_scenes.description: This scene introduces Paul Bunyan as a circus performer and then shifts to the arrival and reactions of circus spectators.

narrative_arcs.title: Circus Spectators Arrive and React to a Giraffe

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation with Billings
sub_scenes.description: Spectators encounter a conflict with Billings, showcasing his strength and leading to a dangerous escalation involving a pistol.

narrative_arcs.title: Responding to a Cry for Help and Confronting Billings
Billings' Display of Superhuman Strength and Attack
Pistol Threat and Escalation of Danger

sub_scenes.title: Resolution and Strongman Proposition
sub_scenes.description: The conflict with Billings is explained, and a proposition is made for the man in plaid to become the new circus strongman.

narrative_arcs.title: Continuing Threats from Billings and the Pistol Man
Exposition on Matto Grasso and Circus Conflict
Proposal to Become the New Strong Man

Major_Arcs.title: Grasso's Revenge and Bunyan's Exit
Major_Arcs.description: Matto Grasso seeks revenge on Paul Bunyan, leading to sabotage, chaos, and ultimately Paul Bunyan's decision to leave the circus despite being offered a job.

sub_scenes.title: Bunyan's Debut and Grasso's Plot
sub_scenes.description: Paul Bunyan debuts as the strongman, inciting Matto Grasso's envy and revenge plot involving kerosene.

narrative_arcs.title: Paul Bunyan's Debut and Grasso's Envy

sub_scenes.title: Ape Unleashed and the Chase
sub_scenes.description: Grasso's next plan involves releasing an ape, leading to chaos and a chase involving a circus worker and Paul Bunyan's attempts to intervene.

narrative_arcs.title: Chase Enters the Arena and Paul Bunyan's Intervention

sub_scenes.title: Fight, Rescue, and Bunyan's Farewell
sub_scenes.description: The chase culminates in a fight involving Matto Grasso (revealed as Sonny), police intervention, and Paul Bunyan's decision to leave the circus.

narrative_arcs.title: Matto's Turn and Dominance in the Fight
The Trapeze Toss and Sonny's Protest
Sonny's Aerial Peril and Trapeze Rescue
Job Offer and Paul's Woodland Yearning

Major_Arcs.title: Marco Polo's Tibetan Adventure
Major_Arcs.description: Marco Polo embarks on adventures in Tibet, encountering a severed head, receiving a magical dagger, and undertaking a mission to rescue Princess Lotus from a witch's castle.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction to Marco Polo and the Severed Head
sub_scenes.description: Marco Polo's adventures are introduced, leading to a gruesome discovery of a talking severed head.

narrative_arcs.title: Marco Polo's Adventures and the Ogress of Tibet
Ghastly Discovery of a Severed Head

sub_scenes.title: Magic Dagger and Journey to Hi-toun
sub_scenes.description: Marco Polo receives a magical dagger and continues his journey, arriving at a city in mourning.

narrative_arcs.title: Life Debt and a Sacred Dagger
Reason for Silence and Parting Ways

sub_scenes.title: Princess Rescue Mission and Witch's Castle
sub_scenes.description: Marco Polo arrives in Hi-toun, learns about the missing princess, and is led to a witch's castle under the guise of helping a distressed woman.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival and Ominous Welcome to Hi-toun
The King's Plea for His Missing Daughter
A Desperate Mother and a Witch's Castle
Entering the Witch's Castle and Unveiling the 'Children'

sub_scenes.title: Ogress Defeat and Royal Reward
sub_scenes.description: Marco Polo, captured by the Ogress, uses the magic knife to escape, rescue the princess, and return her to her father, declining a royal marriage.

narrative_arcs.title: The Fly Blade Attack and Ogress's Downfall

Major_Arcs.title: Treasure of Agra and Betrayal
Major_Arcs.description: A tale of hidden treasure in Agra, India, leads to betrayal, revenge, and a deadly confrontation in an attic over the stolen riches.

sub_scenes.title: Treasure Tale Introduction and Penal Colony
sub_scenes.description: A narrator introduces a tale of treasure, followed by a scene in a penal colony where prisoners plot escape.

narrative_arcs.title: Captain Brooking's Inquiry to Officer Jordan

sub_scenes.title: Treasure Proposition and Captain's Betrayal
sub_scenes.description: A prisoner proposes a treasure deal to Captain Brooking, who agrees but later betrays the prisoner.

sub_scenes.title: Years Pass and Revenge Quest Begins
sub_scenes.description: Years later, the prisoner is freed and returns to England seeking revenge on Captain Brooking.

narrative_arcs.title: Return to England and Renewed Vengeance

sub_scenes.title: Deadly Attic Confrontation and Aftermath
sub_scenes.description: The confrontation in the attic turns deadly as the prisoner kills Captain Brooking to reclaim the treasure, leading to police investigation.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation and Capture of a Suspect
Police Observation and Homicide Squad Call
Moral of the Tale: Money as Evil

Major_Arcs.title: The Haunted Matthews Estate
Major_Arcs.description: A realtor seeks help from Henry Northrup to deal with a haunted estate, leading to a confrontation with the vengeful spirit of Vincent Matthews.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction to the Haunted Estate Problem
sub_scenes.description: Dr. Styx approaches Henry Northrup to investigate the problematic Matthews estate, revealed to be haunted.

narrative_arcs.title: Northrup's Expected Arrival and Supernatural Expertise

sub_scenes.title: Investigation and Confrontation with the Ghost
sub_scenes.description: Henry Northrup arrives at the Matthews estate, ignores warnings, and confronts the ghostly Vincent Matthews.

narrative_arcs.title: Eerie Warning at the Old House
Entering the Haunted House and Confronting Vincent Matthews

sub_scenes.title: Resolution through Forgiveness and Love
sub_scenes.description: The conflict with Vincent Matthews resolves through philosophical discussion, confession, and ultimately forgiveness and brotherly love from his sister's spirit.

narrative_arcs.title: Questioning Violence and Nature of Fear
Confession and Desperate Plea for Love
Physical Restraint and Assertion of Power
Summoning Rosalind and the Opportunity for Redemption
Request for Forgiveness and Millennial Release
Demand for Brotherly Love and Ultimate Freedom

Major_Arcs.title: The Ill-Fated Voyages of Henry Hudson
Major_Arcs.description: The narrative recounts the historical voyages of Henry Hudson, his quest for the Northwest Passage, crew discontent, mutiny, and mysterious disappearance.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction to Hudson's Fate and Commission
sub_scenes.description: The story begins by foreshadowing Hudson's tragic fate and then shifts to his commission by the Dutch East India Company.

narrative_arcs.title: The Strange Fate of Henry Hudson

sub_scenes.title: Voyage and Disappointment
sub_scenes.description: Hudson's voyage faces crew discontent, leads to the exploration of the Hudson River, and ultimately ends in disappointment as no passage to China is found.

narrative_arcs.title: Weeks at Sea and Crew's Discontent
Hudson's Reflection on Failure and Decision to Return Home

sub_scenes.title: New Voyage, Mutiny, and Hudson's Fate
sub_scenes.description: Hudson embarks on a new voyage, gets trapped in ice, faces mutiny, and is ultimately cast adrift, meeting his tragic end.

narrative_arcs.title: Setting Up a New Voyage for the Northwest Passage
Ship Stuck in Ice and Winter Quarters
Ice Melts and Crew's Demand to Return Home
Forced Adrift and Abandonment of Hudson
Arrest of the Mutineers Upon Return

Major_Arcs.title: Hassan the Arabian Knight vs. Tartars
Major_Arcs.description: Hassan, the Arabian Knight, is tasked to rescue a kidnapped woman from Tartar horsemen, leading to a dangerous journey, infiltration, and a duel for her freedom.

sub_scenes.title: The Chase and Mission Briefing
sub_scenes.description: Hassan is introduced in a chase scene and then summoned by the Caliph to rescue a kidnapped woman from the Tartars.

narrative_arcs.title: The Chase and Introduction of Conflict
The Caliph's Summons and Mission Briefing

sub_scenes.title: Journey to the Oasis and Warning
sub_scenes.description: Hassan sets off on his journey, reaches an oasis, finds Tartar tracks, and receives a dire warning from a traveler.

narrative_arcs.title: Setting off to Confront the Tartars
Journey and Anticipation of the Oasis
Discovery of Tartar Tracks at the Oasis
Encounter with a Traveler and Dire Warning

sub_scenes.title: Infiltration and Capture in Tartar Camp
sub_scenes.description: Hassan infiltrates the Tartar camp, finds information about the kidnapped woman, attempts contact, but is captured by guards.

narrative_arcs.title: Ambush and Subjugation of the Sentry
Inside the Tartar Camp - Search Begins
Suspicion and Confrontation by Tartar Guards

sub_scenes.title: Duel and Reward
sub_scenes.description: Hassan is brought before Kurgan, accepts a challenge to fight for the woman's freedom, and after winning, receives his reward and a farewell kiss.

narrative_arcs.title: The Contest Begins and Hassan's Dirt Strategy
Hassan's Victory Over Two Tartar Warriors
Kurgan Honors His Word and Departs
Questioning Hassan's Affection and a Blush
A Farewell Kiss and a Fine Reward

Major_Arcs.title: The Cloaked Villain and Magic Knife (Short Interlude)
Major_Arcs.description: A brief, isolated narrative arc featuring a cloaked villain capturing a man with a sword using snakes and taunting him. This arc is short and doesn't seem to connect to the other major arcs.

sub_scenes.title: Capture by Snakes
sub_scenes.description: A cloaked villain captures a man using fire and snakes, binding and taunting him.

narrative_arcs.title: Initial Fire Attack and Escape Attempt
